statements: SELECT * FROM historical_sales_data WHERE region='East'
SELECT sales_amount, product_id FROM historical_sales_data ORDER BY date DESC
SELECT SUM(sales_amount) AS total_sales FROM historical_sales_data GROUP BY region
SELECT product_id, sales_channel FROM historical_sales_data WHERE sales_channel='Online' AND region='West'
SELECT * FROM historical_sales_data WHERE date > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY date ASC
SELECT * FROM historical_sales_data WHERE region = 'North' ORDER BY date DESC, sales_amount ASC
SELECT product_id, SUM(sales_amount) AS total_sales FROM historical_sales_data GROUP BY product_id HAVING total_sales > 10000
SELECT region, AVG(sales_amount) AS avg_sales FROM historical_sales_data GROUP BY region ORDER BY avg_sales DESC
SELECT date, SUM(sales_amount) AS total_sales FROM historical_sales_data WHERE product_id = 101 GROUP BY date ORDER BY date
SELECT DISTINCT region FROM historical_sales_data WHERE sales_channel IN ('Online', 'Retail')
SELECT * FROM sales_data WHERE quantity_sold > 100;
SELECT product_id, quantity_sold FROM sales_data WHERE revenue > 500;
SELECT sale_date, revenue FROM sales_data WHERE quantity_sold < 50 ORDER BY revenue DESC;
SELECT * FROM demand_forecast WHERE forecast_value >= 1000 ORDER BY forecast_date;
SELECT id, product_id, sale_date FROM sales_data WHERE revenue > 1000 OR quantity_sold > 200 ORDER BY sale_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM sales_data WHERE product_id = 100 ORDER BY sale_date DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT product_id, SUM(quantity_sold) AS total_quantity_sold, SUM(revenue) AS total_revenue FROM sales_data GROUP BY product_id HAVING total_revenue > 1000 ORDER BY total_quantity_sold DESC;
SELECT product_id, COUNT(*) AS total_sales_count, AVG(revenue) AS avg_revenue FROM sales_data GROUP BY product_id ORDER BY avg_revenue DESC;

SELECT sd.product_id, sd.sale_date, df.forecast_date, df.forecast_value, df.confidence_level FROM sales_data sd INNER JOIN demand_forecast df ON sd.product_id = df.product_id WHERE sd.product_id = 200 ORDER BY df.forecast_date ASC;
SELECT product_id, AVG(revenue) AS avg_revenue, MAX(revenue) AS max_revenue, MIN(revenue) AS min_revenue FROM sales_data GROUP BY product_id HAVING avg_revenue > 500 ORDER BY max_revenue DESC;
SELECT * FROM sales_data;
SELECT product_name, sale_amount FROM sales_data WHERE sale_amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customer ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT product_name, price FROM product WHERE category = 'Electronics';
SELECT customer_name, phone_number FROM customer WHERE customer_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT product_name, sale_amount FROM sales_data WHERE sale_date = '2022-01-01'
SELECT customer_name, email, phone_number FROM customer WHERE customer_id = 10
SELECT product_name, price, category FROM product ORDER BY price DESC
SELECT * FROM sales_data WHERE product_name LIKE '%iPhone%' AND sale_amount > 1000
SELECT customer_name, email, product_name, sale_amount FROM customer JOIN sales_data ON customer.customer_id = sales_data.customer_id WHERE sale_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31'
SELECT * FROM Sales_Data WHERE sale_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT product_name, category, supplier_id FROM Products WHERE supplier_id = 1;
SELECT sale_id, quantity, price FROM Sales_Data ORDER BY sale_date DESC;
SELECT supplier_name, address, phone_number FROM Suppliers;
SELECT sale_id, product_id, sale_date, monthly_sales FROM Sales_Analysis WHERE monthly_sales > 1000 ORDER BY sale_date ASC;
SELECT sale_id, sale_date, product_id, quantity, price FROM Sales_Data;
SELECT product_name, category, supplier_id FROM Products ORDER BY product_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Suppliers WHERE supplier_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT MAX(price) AS max_price, MIN(price) AS min_price FROM Sales_Data;
SELECT product_name, category, supplier_name, address, phone_number FROM Products JOIN Suppliers ON Products.supplier_id = Suppliers.supplier_id;
SELECT * FROM HistoricalSalesData;
SELECT product_id, sales_amount FROM HistoricalSalesData WHERE sales_date = '2022-01-01';
SELECT customer_name, email FROM Customers WHERE phone_number LIKE '%1234%';
SELECT region_name, country, manager_id FROM SalesRegions ORDER BY country DESC;
SELECT product_name, unit_price FROM ProductDetails WHERE unit_price > 100 ORDER BY unit_price ASC;
SELECT * FROM HistoricalSalesData;
SELECT product_id, sales_date, sales_amount FROM HistoricalSalesData WHERE sales_amount > 1000;
SELECT product_id, SUM(sales_amount) AS total_sales FROM HistoricalSalesData GROUP BY product_id;
SELECT customers.customer_name, customers.email, SalesRegions.region_name FROM Customers JOIN SalesRegions ON customers.customer_id = SalesRegions.manager_id;
SELECT product_name, unit_price FROM ProductDetails ORDER BY unit_price DESC;
